Key Match Events: Javier Báez surprised his Detroit Tigers teammates by walking into the Progressive Field clubhouse before Game 2 of the ALDS in Cleveland.
Detroit Tigers won a dramatic 3-0 victory over Cleveland in Game 2 of the ALDS.
Pre-Game Insights: Javier Báez, despite being out for the season due to injury, made an effort to join his team, which boosted team morale.
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch discussed the uncertainty of the pitching lineup for Game 3, indicating strategic planning and flexibility.
Post-Match Reflections: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch expressed the importance of Báez's presence for the team's morale and experience.
Cleveland's Steven Kwan commented on the challenge of facing multiple new pitchers, describing it as 'pitching chaos'.
